properties.areaDesc: Glacier Bay; Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island; Eastern Chichagof Island; Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island; Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Inner Channels from Kupreanof Island to Etolin Island; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway; Misty Fjords; Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area; Southern Inner Channels; Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 18 at 9:41PM AKST by NWS Juneau AK
properties.description:
A gale force front will track across the AK Gulf late Friday then
cross over the AK Panhandle Saturday. This system will bring a
combination of increased winds and heavy precipitation.

For the Southern and South Central regions precipitation will
fall mainly as rain with a mix of snow early in the day. Rainfall
totals upwards of 1 to 2 inches possible with only minor snow
accumulation expected.

For the Northeast Gulf Coast and Northern Panhandle there is the
potential for significant snow accumulation through the day, with
higher amounts at higher elevations. The Northeast Gulf Coast
will change over to rain through the day while Juneau and areas
along the Icy Strait corridor may change to rain or only mix with
rain later in the day.

There is also the potential for another significant weather
system impacting the region on Monday with more heavy rain, snow,
and increased winds.

Please stay tuned to NOAA Weather radio or your favorite local
weather news source as well as checking www.weather.gov/Juneau
for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: STRONG WEATHER SYSTEM IMPACTING THE AK PANHANDLE SATURDAY

title: current watches, warnings, and advisories for 58.8353 N, 136.85 W
